sections.MISSION:
Bull Troop conducts AT4/M320 range, practice qualification and qualification at RG 203 and 203A on 29NOV23 IOT maintain a high level of readiness with individual weapons proficiency

sections.PURPOSE: Ensure Bull Troop SMs are fundamentally sound on all levels on marksmanship with the AT4 and M320 IOT prepare for upcoming training events and maintain lethality within Bull Troop.

subtasks.hazard: Adverse Weather Conditions- Wet, Icy and Muddy Conditions Lightning Strike

values: Ensure vehicles are equipped with (chains, good tires, lights, wipers) and maintained to handle expected adverse conditions.
Reduce speed; increase following distance
Ensure VCs and air guards remain name tap defilade at all times.
Utilize ground guides in potentially dangerous situations.
Full road conditions report from 7ATC website daily
In the case of lightning warning from 7ATC, all personnel will clear out of the ammo point, and call the range dry until Range Ops gives the directive to resume training.

subtasks.hazard: Backblast area for AT weapons (AT-4, Javelin, M3)

values: Teams and safeties will visually and verbally clear the backblast area 100m out and 50 degrees of all personnel and movable objects
-Rehearsals -Safety brief, lane walkers ensure firers are following backblast procedure
-RSO/OIC -Squad leaders -Safeties

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders must ensure individuals who handle ammunition, explosives, and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have 2x ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand.
Separate ammunition points will be established for live and blank rounds. - Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Do not transport ammunition and personnel on same vehicle.
REG Ammunition Warrant Officer confirms training, ammunition on hand, distribution, and safe storage/handling procedures.
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions
-Ammunition OIC -Small Unit Leaders -Safeties - Leadership

subtasks.hazard: Ignorance of load, unload, and clearing procedures

values: Weapons will remain on safe and unloaded until instructed by the NCOIC

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The Troop/PLTs/Sections will receive a safety/convoy brief prior to and from the range.  The range OIC will give a range brief that will discusses all the safety measures and standards of the range. All NCO's with their respective sections will enforce all standards outlined in the DRAW and safety brief. A medic will be on site with a CASEVAC NTV or a MEV.  All OC/Ts will also enforce all standards outlined in the DRAW and safety brief. A copy of this signed risk assessment will be maintained in the range books at both ranges.
